oai_dc:dc.dc:title: British sending American propaganda to the German soldiers via small balloons
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees, that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military vehicles; Trucks; Balloons; Propaganda; Military personnel; Soldiers; Military uniforms; Uniforms; Helmets; Campaigns & battles; War; Balloon ascensions; Communication devices; War allies; World War, 1914-1918
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Image features British troops in a field gathered around military trucks containing tanks of inflating gas. American propaganda materials are being suspended from small air balloons that will convey them to German soldiers. In the photo, one balloon is being readied while another is already airborne. A number of British military personnel have congregated around the operation to observe. This image's Signal Corp identification number is SC#28390.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States. Army. Signal Corps
